action.action-desc: Mr. Kim of New Jersey introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To amend the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to expand certain authorities with respect to the recall of controlled substances to apply with respect to all drugs, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Protecting Americans from Unsafe Drugs Act of 2022.

section.header: Notification, nondistribution, and recall of drugs

subsection.header: Order To cease distribution and recall
subsection.text: Section 569D of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act (21 U.S.C. 360bbb–8d) is amended—

paragraph.text: in the section heading, by striking controlled substances and inserting drugs;
by striking controlled substance each place such term appears and inserting drug;

subparagraph.text: by striking controlled substances and inserting drugs; and
by inserting of subsection (a) after an order pursuant to paragraph (1) or an amended order pursuant to subparagraph (B) or (C) of paragraph (3); and

paragraph.text: in subsection (c), by striking or an official senior to such Director and inserting or the Director of the Center for Biologics Evaluation and Research (or an official senior to either such Director).

subsection.text: Section 801(a) of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act (21 U.S.C. 381(a)) is amended by striking is a controlled substance subject to an order under section 569D and inserting is a drug subject to an order under section 569D.
